fullDescription.intro: This node joins two Spark RDDs in a database-like way. The join is based on the joining columns of both RDDs.

tab.name: Joiner settings
tab.option: If a row from the left RDD cannot be joined with a row from the right RDD (and vice versa) there are several options of handling this situation. After an Inner Join only matching rows will show up in the output RDD. A Left Outer Join will fill up the columns that come from the right RDD with missing values if no matching row exists in the right RDD. Likewise, a Right Outer Join will fill up the columns from the left RDD with missing values if no matching row in the left RDD exists. A Full Outer Join will fill up columns from both the left and right RDD with missing values if a row cannot be joined.

Select the columns from the left input RDD and the right input RDD that should be used for joining. You may selected a real column here. You must make sure, that the type of selected columns matches.
Match all of the following: A row of the left input RDD and a row of the right input RDD match if they match in all specified column pairs.
Match any of the following: A row of the left input table and a row of the right input RDD match if they match in at least one specified column pairs.

tab.name: Column selection

option.name: Column Selection (Left RDD and Right RDD)

tab.option:
Exclude: This list contains the column names of the input RDD that are excluded.
Select: Use these buttons to move columns between the Include and Exclude list.
Include: This list contains the column names that are included.
Search: Use one of these fields to search either within the Include or Exclude list for certain column names or name substrings. Repeated clicking of the search button marks the next column that matches the search text. The check box 'Select all search hits' causes all matching columns to be selected making them movable between the two lists.
Always include all columns: If set, all columns are moved to the include list and if input changes all new columns will be in the include list, too.

The option allows you to change the behaviour if the include lists of both input RDDs contain columns with the same name.
Filter duplicates: Only the columns from the left input RDD will show up in the output RDD.
Don't execute: Don't allow to execute this node if there are duplicate column names in the include lists.
Append suffix: Append a suffix to the duplicate column names from the right input RDD so that they also show up in the output RDD.
The option allows filtering the left/right joining columns, i.e. the joining columns defined in the Joiner Settings tab will not show up in the output RDD.
